intro: Microstemon annamensis, commonly known as the Annam microstemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
